name: Classic Dinner Rolls
summary: Who can resist warm yeast rolls, fresh from the oven?
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, or more if needed
directions: Combine 3/4 cup flour, undissolved yeast, sugar and salt in a large bowl
Heat milk, water and butter until very warm (120 degrees to 130 degrees F)
Beat 2 minutes at medium speed of electric mixer, scraping bowl occasionally
Add 1/4 cup flour; beat 2 minutes at high speed
Stir in enough remaining flour to make soft dough
Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 8 to 10 minutes
Divide dough into 12 equal pieces; shape into balls
Cover; let rise in warm, draft-free place until doubled in size, about 30 minutes
Bake in preheated 375 degrees F oven for 20 minutes or until done
Remove from pan; brush with additional melted butter, if desired
